intro: Trisyngyne pseudoresinosa, commonly known as the false resin plant, is a unique species belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive floral structure, featuring three stamens and a single pistil, which is typical of the genus Trisyngyne. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences, and its leaves are alternate and ovate in shape. It is native to specific regions in South America and thrives in moist, tropical environments. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat, Trisyngyne pseudoresinosa is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
